content: 3 row christmas star ornament by criss wall i had a huge collection of half balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out so i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i wanted a set of small christmas ornaments to give away as part of my raock random acts of crochet kindness gifts this is my 3 row puffy star pattern notes & materials  yarn of your choice in any ply  scissors hook tapestry needle etc  please use your choice of hook size for this pattern based on the yarn thickness but as a guide for 8ply/dk i use a 3 5mm or 4mm for 10ply/aran i use a 4 5mm or 5mm hook  the star measures around 7 cm 2 3/4 inches tip to tip with 8ply/dk and about 9cm 3 1/2 inches with 10ply/aran  yarn required using a 3 5mm hook and 8ply/dk 9 metres 10 yards for a 4 5mm hook and 10ply/aran about 11 metres 12 yards stitches us terms  chain  slip_stitch slip_stitch  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  puff - a normal puff crocheted with loose gauge in total you draw up a loop/pull through a loop 5 times before yarning over and pulling through all 11 stitches so there is only one stitch left on the hook in the pattern we chain twice after the puff criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/3-row-christmas-star-ornament instructions row 1 create a magic_ring we are going to crochet 5 puffs into the ring i use a 5 loop puff but you can decrease or increase the size of the puff as you choose please refer to the puff description on the first page now complete - * puff chain 2 * five times for a total of 5 puffs close the round with a slip stitch into the space above the first puff after you have closed the round and pulled your magic_ring tight you are going to look at it and think that row isn t flat that is exactly what we want actually… lol we want the puffs forced out to the front of the star push on the puffs from behind so that they are puffing to the front and the tighter ring is behind them row 2 look at each puff there is a little space or gap above each one that is where we will crochet this row into we miss all the chain spaces chain 1 ignore this chain going forward in the space/gap work * 3 half_double_crochet chain 1 3 half_double_crochet * you will now have 6 stitches in the space that is the first shell of stitches above the puff miss the 2 chain from the row below and crochet the following into the next space above the puff - * 3 half_double_crochet chain 1 3 half_double_crochet *
